header.title: httpd_util

erlref.modulesummary: Miscellaneous utility functions to be used when implementing Erlang web server API modules.

description.p: This module provides the Erlang web server API module programmer with miscellaneous utility functions.

func.name: convert_request_date(DateString) -> ErlDate|bad_date
func.fsummary: Converts the date to the Erlang date format.

type.v: Year = Month = Date = Hour = Min = Sec = integer()

desc.p: convert_request_date/1 converts DateString to the Erlang date format. DateString must be in one of the three date formats defined in RFC 2616.

func.name: create_etag(FileInfo) -> Etag
func.fsummary: Calculates the Etag for a file.

desc.p: create_etag/1 calculates the Etag for a file from its size and time for last modification. FileInfo is a record defined in kernel/include/file.hrl.

func.name: day(NthDayOfWeek) -> DayOfWeek
func.fsummary: Converts the day of the week (integer [1-7]) to an abbreviated string.

func.name: decode_hex(HexValue) -> DecValue
func.fsummary: Converts a hexadecimal value into its decimal equivalent.

desc.p: Converts the hexadecimal value HexValue into its decimal equivalent (DecValue).

func.name: flatlength(NestedList) -> Size
func.fsummary: Computes the size of a possibly nested list.

desc.p: flatlength/1 computes the size of the possibly nested list NestedList, which can contain binaries.

func.name: hexlist_to_integer(HexString) -> Number
func.fsummary: Converts a hexadecimal string to an integer.

desc.p: hexlist_to_integer converts the hexadecimal value of HexString to an integer.

func.name: integer_to_hexlist(Number) -> HexString
func.fsummary: Converts an integer to a hexadecimal string.

desc.p: integer_to_hexlist/1 returns a string representing Number in a hexadecimal form.

func.name: lookup(ETSTable,Key) -> Result
lookup(ETSTable,Key,Undefined) -> Result
func.fsummary: Extracts the first value associated with a Key in an ETS table.

desc.p: lookup extracts {Key,Value} tuples from ETSTable and returns the Value associated with Key. If ETSTable is of type bag, only the first Value associated with Key is returned. lookup/2 returns undefined and lookup/3 returns Undefined if no Value is found.

func.name: lookup_mime(ConfigDB,Suffix)
lookup_mime(ConfigDB,Suffix,Undefined) -> MimeType
func.fsummary: Returns the MIME type associated with a specific file suffix.

desc.p:
lookup_mime returns the MIME type associated with a specific file suffix as specified in the file mime.types (located in the
config directory).

func.name: lookup_mime_default(ConfigDB,Suffix)
lookup_mime_default(ConfigDB,Suffix,Undefined) -> MimeType
func.fsummary: Returns the MIME type associated with a specific file suffix or the value of the DefaultType.

desc.p:
lookup_mime_default returns the MIME type associated with a specific file suffix as specified in the mime.types file (located in the
config directory). If no appropriate association is found, the value of DefaultType is returned.

func.name: message(StatusCode,PhraseArgs,ConfigDB) -> Message
func.fsummary: Returns an informative HTTP 1.1 status string in HTML.

desc.p: message/3 returns an informative HTTP 1.1 status string in HTML. Each StatusCode requires a specific PhraseArgs:

item.p: string(): A URL pointing at the new document position.
string(): A Request-URI as described in RFC 2616.
{Method,RequestURI,HTTPVersion}: The HTTP Method, Request-URI, and HTTP-Version as defined in RFC 2616.
string(): A string describing why the service was unavailable.

func.name: month(NthMonth) -> Month
func.fsummary: Converts the month as an integer (1-12) to an abbreviated string.

func.name: multi_lookup(ETSTable,Key) -> Result
func.fsummary: Extracts the values associated with a key in an ETS table.

desc.p: multi_lookup extracts all {Key,Value} tuples from an ETSTable and returns all Values associated with Key in a list.

func.name: reason_phrase(StatusCode) -> Description
func.fsummary: Returns the description of an HTTP 1.1 status code.

desc.p: reason_phrase returns Description of an HTTP 1.1 StatusCode, for example, 200 is "OK" and 201 is "Created". For more information, see RFC 2616.

func.name: rfc1123_date() -> RFC1123Date
rfc1123_date({{YYYY,MM,DD},{Hour,Min,Sec}}) -> RFC1123Date
func.fsummary: Returns the current date in RFC 1123 format.

type.v: YYYY = MM = DD = Hour = Min = Sec = integer()

desc.p: rfc1123_date/0 returns the current date in RFC 1123 format. rfc_date/1 converts the date in the Erlang format to the RFC 1123 date format.

func.name: split(String,RegExp,N) -> SplitRes
func.fsummary: Splits a string in N chunks using a regular expression.

desc.p: split/3 splits String in N chunks using RegExp. split/3 is equivalent to regexp:split/2 with the exception that N defines the maximum number of fields in FieldList.

func.name: split_script_path(RequestLine) -> Splitted
func.fsummary: Splits a RequestLine in a file reference to an executable, and a QueryString or a PathInfostring.

desc.p: split_script_path/1 is equivalent to split_path/1 with one exception. If the longest possible path is not a regular, accessible, and executable file, then not_a_script is returned.

func.name: split_path(RequestLine) -> {Path,QueryStringOrPathInfo}
func.fsummary: Splits a RequestLine in a file reference, and a QueryString or a PathInfo string.

desc.p: split_path/1 splits RequestLine in a file reference (Path), and a QueryString or a PathInfo string as specified in RFC 2616. A QueryString is isolated from Path with a question mark (?) and PathInfo with a slash (/). In the case of a QueryString, everything before ? is a Path and everything after ? is a QueryString. In the case of a PathInfo, RequestLine is scanned from left-to-right on the hunt for longest possible Path being a file or a directory. Everything after the longest possible Path, isolated with a /, is regarded as PathInfo. The resulting Path is decoded using decode_hex/1 before delivery.

func.name: strip(String) -> Stripped
func.fsummary: Returns String where the leading and trailing space tabs are removed.

desc.p: strip/1 removes any leading or trailing linear white space from the string. Linear white space is to be read as horizontal tab or space.

func.name: suffix(FileName) -> Suffix
func.fsummary: Extracts the file suffix from a given filename.

desc.p: suffix/1 is equivalent to filename:extension/1 with the exception that Suffix is returned without a leading dot (.).
